title: Anyone got good midi makin' programs?
content:
I wanna good midi makin' program. Here we go again...[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-pig.gif[/img]

I won't be interested in it if...
* It costs money and the trial doesn't have all the features or will stop runnin' after n days.
* It is hard to use.

I would prefer it if...
* It's free.
- It doesn't require a keyboard.
- It's windows only.
* It's easy to use.
* It works.

Key
* Important
- Unimportant

Sorry if this has been asked b4...[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] Signed, Harvey Smith
A proud member of the beta testing society
"I help entertain!" -Harvey
Tough guys have no table manners![img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopefish.gif[/img]

title: Re: Anyone got good midi makin' programs?
content:
Well, nothing is basically just click-and-go, you need to learn some basics.. Perhaps this:
[url=http://www.milkytracker.net/]www.milkytracker.net/[/url]Eat your veggies!

title: Re: Anyone got good midi makin' programs?
content:
NoteWorthy Composer. One of the best out there I have found. You can compose your own music or import a midi file and edit it. It has a lot of advanced features in it.

[url=http://www.noteworthysoftware.com/]www.noteworthysoftware.com/[/url]

You can either buy the full version or just download the free trial. The difference is the free trial only lets you save like... five times or something. You can get around this by making a new file and copy-paste everything into the new one. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img]

I never tried the other suggestions though. I'll have to look into them later.-----------------------
[url=http://Galaxie.Spatang.com][img]http://i34.photobucket.com/albums/d134/Galaxieretter/Blegdandsmeegdbanner60copy.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Anyone got good midi makin' programs?
content:
Just a side notice: Noteworthy Composer uses standard music notation (ie sheet music that you'd find in a music book) to input music, so if you can't read standard music notation then you'd be better off using something else.[url=http://last.fm/users/grafix5000/][img]http://toxicsheep.com/sigs/scrobbler.png[/img][/url]
[url=http://toxicsheep.com]toxicsheep.com[/url] | [url=http://commanderkeen.org]coming up next...[/url]

title: Re: Anyone got good midi makin' programs?
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]I won't be interested in it if...
*cost mony or the trial runs out after n amount of days[hr][/quote]

It only offers a 30 day trial... it cost money: I need software which can put misicyou play in from your keyboard via midi cable, into sheet music; If I can get it to also make a midi while it's at it, it'd be better; noteworthy might do this... right?

I need this cause I am writting up some of my songs, and entering one into a compitition... so puncuality is crucial.

Thanks!

title: Re: Anyone got good midi makin' programs?
content:
Doesn't their website say what the limitations of the trial version are?

By the way, if I were producing scores I'd type them up in such a way that [url=http://lilypond.org/]Lilypond[/url] could render them. It's not graphical of course, but it's pretty easy, and gives great output.________________
